text: december 25, 1642, julian calendar, sir isaac newton is born. jesus, on the other hand, was actually born in the summer. his birthday was moved to coincide with a traditional pagan holiday that celebrated the winter solstice with lit fires and slaughtered goats. which, frankly, sounds like more fun than 12 hours of church with my mother followed by a fruitcake.
